page.title: 03GOSPORT IN THE PAST
page.content: Memories of a{'Gosportian'}cont. "The floating bridge took me to Old Portsmouth and from there I could shop in Southsea." "When I crossed to Portsmouth by ferry I would often see the 'mudlarks'. These were children who dived for coins thrown by people into the muddy area by The Hard. Instead of a bus I could catch a trolley bus which ran on rails powered by overhead electricity, from here." She also told us that life seemed much slower then, with fewer cars and no televisions. People seemed more able to entertain themselves although she thought that many missed the three cinemas that have since closed down.
